The Pelicans finished at just 36.7 percent.
Golden State Warriors shot 47.1 percent as a team.
Golden State outscored the visitors 39-33 on 3-pointers.
Zion Williamson was held to 12 points on 5-for-20 shooting.
Golden State took the opener of the two-day, two-game series 124-106.
Stephen Curry missed his second straight game with a left ankle injury.

Golden State Warriors pulled away from the visiting New Orleans Pelicans for a 104-89 victory.
The Warriors have the second-best defensive rating in the league (98.4), only trailing the Thunder (91.3).
The Warriors have held two of their first five opponents below 90 points, including the Pelicans on Wednesday.
